author: greystroke
content: I think the better solution here, now that validatorconversions to 0x02 mainly via withdrawal and redeposit are finally in full swing is to increase the  validator queues churn to a maximum of 512E/epochs from the current 256E/epochs which no longer serves a good purpose. It made sense when we were trying to slow validator growth, but now it is slowing consolidations and causing unnecessary LST depegs which is creating a vicious cycle where the depeg creates an arbitage opportunity that fuels more withdrawals and deposits and therefore a longer queue.

author: fradamt
content: One reason why they're 256E/epoch is consolidations actually, because consolidations also consume churn, and they basically consume the "extra churn" that's saved by keeping exits and activations at 256. One option is to fix the consolidation churn at 256E/epoch and make the entry and exit churn be "free" (remove the cap, make it linearly scale like before), essentially just being ok with having the consolidation churn degrade the weak subjectivity period somewhat (it's equivalent to adding 256E/epoch of both entries and exits, so a 50% churn increase when we are at 512)

author: fradamt
content: anyway, we can't really do anything about it until Glamsterdam
